1.q_string: A \(1\mathrm{~kg}\) ball moving at \(12 \mathrm{~m/s}\) collides head-on with a \(2 \mathrm{~kg}\) ball moving in the opposite direction at \(24 \mathrm{~m/s}\). What is the velocity of each ball after the impact if the coefficient of restitution is ?

A crane is used to lift 10000 kg of coal from a mine 100 m deep. If the time taken to lift coal by the crane is1 hour, then what is the power of the driving mechanism of the crane?

(Efficiency of the crane is 80%, g = 9.8 m/s2)

A particle of mass m has half the kinetic energy of another particle of mass \(\frac{m}{2}\). If the speed of the heavier particle is increased by 2 ms–1, its new kinetic energy equals the original kinetic energy of the lighter particle. The ratio of the original speeds of the lighter and heavier particles is:

The figure above shows a smooth curved track terminating in a smooth horizontal part. A spring of spring constant \(400 \mathrm{~N} / \mathrm{m}\) is attached at one end to the wedge fixed rigidly with the horizontal part. A \(40 \mathrm{~g}\) mass is released from a position of rest at a height of \(4.9 \mathrm{~m}\) on the curved track. What is the maximum compression of the spring? \(\left(\right.\) Take \(\left.\mathrm{g}=9.8 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}^{2}\right)\)

A uniform chain of length \(L\) and mass \(M\) is lying on a smooth table and \(\frac{1}{3}\) of its length is hanging vertically down over the edge of the table. If \(g\) is acceleration due to gravity, the work required to pull the hanging part on the table is:

A shell is fired from a canon with velocity \(\mathrm{v} \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s}\) at an angle \(\theta\) with the horizontal direction. At the highest point in its path it explodes into pieces of equal mass. One of the pieces retraces its path to the canon and the speed in \(\mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s}\) of the other piece immediately after the explosion is ____________.

A pendulum consists of a wooden bob of mass \(m\) and length \(\mathrm{I}\). A bullet of mass \(\mathrm{m}_{1}\) is fired towards the pendulum with a speed \(v_{1}\). If the bullet emerges out of the bob with a speed \(\frac{v_{1}}{3}\), and the bob just completes motion along a vertical circle, then \(v_{1}\) is:

A bullet of mass m moving with a horizontal velocity v1 strikes a stationary block of mass M suspended by a string of length L. The bullet gets embedded in the block. What is the maximum angle made by the string after the impact?
A body falling from a height of 10 m rebounds from a hard floor. If it loses 20% of its energy during the impact, then it will rise up to
What is the velocity of the bob of a simple pendulum at its mean position, if it is able to rise to a vertical height of 20 cm? (g = 9.8 m/s2)
If the speed of a vehicle increases by 2 m/s, its KE is doubled. The original speed of the vehicle was:
A body of mass \(400 \mathrm{~g}\) is rotating in a circular path of radius \(\mathrm{r}\) with constant velocity. What is the work done in one complete revolution?
If the momentum of a body is increased by 60%, then its KE increases by:

Two carts of masses \(200 \mathrm{~kg}\) and \(300 \mathrm{~kg}\) respectively standing on horizontal straight rails are pushed apart by an explosions of the device kept in connecting mechanism of carts. The coefficient of friction between carts and rails are identical. If the \(200 \mathrm{~kg}\) cart travels a distance \(36 \mathrm{~cm}\) and stops, what is the distance covered by cart weighing \(300 \mathrm{~kg}\) :
A solid ball of density half that of water falls freely under gravity from a height of 19.6 m and then enters water. Up to what depth will the ball go? (g = 9.8 m/s2)

The PE between 2 atoms in a molecule is given by \(u(x)=\frac{a}{x^{12}}-\frac{b}{x^{6}}\) where a and \(b\) are positive constants and \(x\) is the distance between the atoms. The atoms are in stable equilibrium when _____________.
If a bag of mass M hangs by a long thread and a bullet of mass m comes horizontally with velocity v and gets caught in the bag, then for combined (bag + bullet) system
A cord is used to lower vertically a block of mass \(m\) to a distance \(d\) at a constant downward acceleration of \(\frac{g}{5}\). The work done by the cord on the block is
A particle moves under the effect of a force F = cx from x = 0 to x1. The work done in the process is:
The work done in pulling up a block of wood weighing 2 kN for a length of 10 m on a smooth plane inclined at an angle of 15° with the horizontal is ________. (sin 15° = 0.2588)
The scalar product of two vectors A and B is ______________.
The scalar product of two vectors A and B in terms of the magnitudes and angle θ is:
The scalar product of two vectors A and B in terms of the projections of the vectors on the x, y and z axis is
The scalar product of vectors is:

q_option: work done on it by the aerodynamic force
work done on it by the net force
work done on it by some force
1.q_string: The change in kinetic energy of a particle is equal to the ___________.
